intro: Convolvulus verticillatus, commonly known as the spiral bindweed, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is characterized by its twining stems that spiral around supports, and its small, five-petaled flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous seeds. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in open, sunny habitats. Due to its aggressive growth habit, it can become invasive in certain regions.
